none: media/user/SCRAPE/test/2018-06-wet-drag/extracted/Wet Drag/01 The Cream and The Clear

Originally ripped by Terminal Escape, posted on June 24, 2018 Description from Terminal Escape:
Like a garage No Wave outfit from an alternate plane, Oakland's WET DRAG swerve around four tracks of damaged primitive indie with a casual deliberation. Occasionally breaking into awkwardly addictive melodies ("Too Young," for example) the vibe is somewhere between PIL playing on a broken turntable and East Bay Ray playing guitar for BLURT....on Klonopin. The line between intentional pretension and accidental brilliance is a blurry one, y'all.  SILOUETTE YEAH
https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-j8tlFMU7BAo/Wy-ezhWlmuI/AAAAAAAATc4/1EIJOBd5IboI_Bm82fQroXADFAdEvEZ3wCLcBGAs/s1600/Wet%2BDrag%2Bfront%2Bcopy.jpg
